Image-Based Subtitles¶

class scinoephile.ocr.ImageSubtitleSeries[source]¶

Bases: scinoephile.SubtitleSeries.SubtitleSeries, scinoephile.ocr.OCRBase

A series of image-based subtitles

event_class¶

alias of scinoephile.ocr.ImageSubtitleEvent.ImageSubtitleEvent

char_predictions¶

Predicted confidence that each character image is each matchable character

Type:ndarray(float)
data¶

Dedupulicated character image data collected from all subtitles

Type:ndarray
spec¶

Specifications describing each character image

Type:DataFrame
data_dtype¶

dtype of image data

Type:type
spec_dtypes¶

names and dtypes of columns in spec

Type:OrderedDict(str, type)
assign_char(index, char)[source]¶

Assigns a character to a character image

Parameters:
  • index (int) – Index of character image to assign
  • char (str) – Character to assign to image
calculate_accuracy(infile, n_chars, assign=True)[source]¶

Calculates accuracy of predicted text relative to known standard

Parameters:
  • infile (str) – Path to standard infile
  • n_chars (int) – Number of matchable characters
  • assign (boot) – Copy character assignments from standard
get_subchar_indexes_of_char_index(index)[source]¶

Converts the index of a deduplicated character into a list of indexes of that character’s appearances within subtitles

Parameters:index (int) – Index of deduplicated character
Returns:
Indexes of character within subtitles in the
form of (subtitle index within series, character index within subtitle)
Return type:list(tuple(int, int))
manually_assign_chars(start_index=0)[source]¶

Interactively confirm character assignments

Parameters:start_index (index) – Character index at which to start interactive character assignment
predict(model)[source]¶

Predicts confidence that each character image is each matchable chararcter

Stores results in both this series’ char_predictions and in each event’s char_predictions

Parameters:model (model?) – TensorFlow model with which to predict characters
reconstruct_text()[source]¶

Reconstructs text for each subtitle

save(path, format_=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Saves subtitles to an output file

Note

pysubs2.SSAFile.save expects an open text file, so we open the hdf5 file here for consistency.

Parameters:
  • path (str) – Path to output file
  • format (str, optional) – Output file format
  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments
show(indexes=None, data=None, cols=20)[source]¶

Shows images of selected characters

If called from within Jupyter notebook, shows inline. If imgcat module is available, shows inline in terminal. Otherwise opens a new window.

Parameters:
  • indexes (int, list, ndarray, optional) – Indexes of characters to show
  • data (ndarray, optional) – Character data to show
  • cols (int, optional) – Number of columns of characters
classmethod load(path, format_=None, mode='8 bit', verbosity=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Loads subtitles from an input file

Notes

pysubs2.SSAFile.from_file expects an open text file, so we open
the hdf5 file here for consistency
Parameters:
  • path (str) – Path to input file
  • format (str, optional) – Input file format
  • mode (str, optional) – Input file image mode
  • verbosity (int, optional) – Level of verbose output
  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments
Returns:

Loaded subtitles
Return type:
